text: Aspergillus tamarii is a species of fungus in the genus Aspergillus. It is from the Flavi section. The species was first described in 1913.Kita, G. 1913, Centralbl. Bakteriol., Abt. 2 37: 433 A. tamarii has been used in the production of soy sauce.Jong SC, Birmingham JM (1992). Current status of fungal culture collections and their role in biotechnology. In: Handbook of applied mycology, vol. 4:. Fungal biotechnology (Arora DK, Elander RP, Murekji KG, eds) New York: Marcel Dekker: 993–1024. It has been isolated from soil in the United States. ==Growth and morphology== A. tamarii has been cultivated on both Czapek yeast extract agar (CYA) plates and Malt Extract Agar Oxoid® (MEAOX) plates. The growth morphology of the colonies can be seen in the pictures below.
